mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Was absent during visit of Mr. Holly who brought his letter of Feb. 11; grateful for the pamphlets sent of Constant and Scheffer; these and others explain state and prospects of Europe; believes France and countries north will attain object of representative government in which people have effectual control; hopes Quesney will have safe entrance into country and find oppression withdrawn.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826--Correspondence
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1818 May 18, Monticello, [Albemarle County, Virginia] to [Quinette] de Rochemont, n.p.
